Reviews.Title: “this constant world traveller gives the nippon a thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: bobbik2
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel very much - great location, very clean, modern rooms, and good price. I travel all the time and stay in countless hotels. I don't think you'd make a mistake booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adeelanwer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on triple sharing. The hotel is amazing, with excellent rooms and ambiance. the breakfast spread was amazing and the staff very courteous. The location is also not bad at all with Taksim square a stones throw away. It was good value for money and its recommended for families as well as friends.

Reviews.Title: “I just like the Nippon”
Reviews.Author: Jfors
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel several times over the last years and I have never been disappointed. The room has a decent size, it is clean and all staff are very friendly. The location of the Nippon Hotel is unbeatable as you are very close to Taksim Square which is a buzzling place with a lot of shopping and dinning possibilities.the only drawback for me has always been the breakfast as the choice is not so big. However as I mentioned you have a lot of choices near by so I do not really mind.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay,very clean”
Reviews.Author: maria g
Reviews.Content: very good location,very clean rooms,sufficient breakfast,very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Recommended business stay”
Reviews.Author: roy2guy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located at the hotels area near the Taxim square. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and all the communications were done in adequate English without any problem. The room was very tidy and clean, and well equipped, but still a bit small. The breakfast was good, with sufficient selection and good quality. The only disadvantage was its price which was somehow above my expectations considering the low season period. I would be happy to stay again at the Nippon hotel on my next visit to Istanbul, but would still check the prices of equivalent hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Price is high”
Reviews.Author: ecealtan
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very near to taksim square, rooms are big, breakfeast is good but prices is very high for these.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated near Taksim square. The hotel rooms were pleasant and staff was helpful and not overwhelming. Not enough people speaking adequate English was a major problem. Breakfast was poor, quite a big selection but poor quality. One side of the hotel is noisy especially at night because of neighbouring generators.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of Ä°stanbul good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Taylan A
Reviews.Content: Very well trained staff from entrance to dining and room care. Parking facilities and vale service great convenience. Breakfast is good but could be better in the sense that bacon and eggs the traditional non muslim menu should be included. The hotel is very close to all sorts of transport means i.e.metro, bus, THY airport shuttles stop, touristic bus tours stop etc. I would stay at Nippon next time I'm in stanbul; in fact I'm coming back in March for the Eurasiarail Fair.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.... poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: S3r
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was a strong air freshner smell as I approached the reception desk there was a strong smell of sewers which was constantly there for the 6 days I stayed there. The staff were friendly until I was shown my room, twin room instead of double as I requested, then they became a bit patronising advising there were no more rooms and insisting that is what i had asked for. Anyway after being persistant they found me a double room - small room very hot 29 degrees the aircon did not work so i asked to be moved to another room which they accomodated, but again very patronising. I understand Turkish therefore i could hear the lady behid the desk making fun of me to her colleague! The rooms were clean, comfortable beds, fresh bottled water everyday. But that is all i can give it credit for unfortunately. Our new room overlooked builders the views are only of other buildings and there are no views of taksim square. Other guests on our floor were loud and kept slamming the doors. I personally would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ReachP
Reviews.Content: Why only a 3 you say....because the breakfast was pretty crappy (and that is the start of the day) and the thermostat in both our rooms did not work (and that is the end of the day when you are trying to sleep)....but if you can be good humoured about it (as we were) - do stay at this central location!

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lara2707
Reviews.Content: Great location (it's where you WANT to be in Istanbul, close to Taksim Square and Istiklal Street- plenty of bars and clubs and restaurants), great staff (everyone speaks english and is willing to help you all the time), super clean, loved my room and the shower and the extremely comfortable bed :)

Reviews.Title: “A boring hotel - warning for rouge shoe polishers outside”
Reviews.Author: style_uncompromised
Reviews.Content: It is with regret I have to write a second unflattering review of a hotel in Istanbul. However, after two congresses this year (several months apart) in that city I cannot but warn other people. The city and its hotels must improve significantly if they wish to comply with the congressing standards of other major destinations. The Nippon hotel, in focus for this discussion, is similar to my earlier reviewed Point hotel, but even less inspiring and with technical room problems accompanied by poor service. My room airconditionining was trying to create a sauna in there, with the cooling not working at all. I informed the reception but nothing was adjusted and no alternative room was offered. Also, for such a large hotel the breakfast buffet was remarkably poor on the meats side. No pure meats or other high protein foods; only spongy sausages with unidentifiable content. Last but not least, Avoid staying here in connection to a congress at the Istanbul International Congress Centre (ICC) which is some 10 min walk away along a heavily trafficked main road. At the time of writing this review I have stayed at two medium class business hotels in Taksim, Istanbul, and the Nippon Hotel is the poorer one of them. For both hotels, intenrational guests should be aware that there are rouge 'shoepolishers' on way to the walk to the ICC. They look like tramps and try attract the attention of tourists by seemingly accidentally dropping one of their shoe polish tools on the street. Whatever you do - do NOT attempt to help. If you do that they will want to polish your shoes 'as a thankful gesture' only to then aggressively demand ridiculous amounts of money for the provided 'service'. This leaves a bitter aftertaste - you feel robbed - and the fact that these tramps (another gorilla tramp; same trick) were still outside the hotel 8 months after my first visit to Taksim just shows that the Istanbul congress hotels do not care too much about their tourists. If I ever have to go back to the ICC I will insist to stay at the Hilton next door to ICC. Whatever it costs it will be worth the difference.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Huda A
Reviews.Content: Good location, cleaned and modern hotel , breakfast has a lot of variety, certainly I will stay in Nippon hotel next time I paln to visit Istanbul and I highly recommended it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nippon Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pmargolies
Reviews.Content: Great value, pleasant and helpful staff. Clean room and comfortable bed. Smaller room was cozy. Faros close by to eat was great; bartender insisted we try Turkish wine -- good suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Taksim Sq Area”
Reviews.Author: Reyes11377
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nippon Hotel for 5 nights. The hotel is very nice. We had a deluxe corner room, which was relatively spacious with a separate seating area. My only real complaint is that the Concierge asked us if we were aware that the room only had one bed (we are a same-sex couple), to which I replied yes and then there was a moment of awkward silence. They then proceeded with the check-in. My subsequent impression of the staff was they were very stand off-ish with us. However, at no time was anyone rude to us. The facilities of the hotel are great. The restaurant is very nice and the fitness center is impeccable. One of the best I have seen in a hotel. One of the best things is the location of the hotel. It is very close to Taksim Square, but on a quiet street with several other hotels in the area. Taksim is much like Times Square, so I appreciated being able to have a little quite and calm with a hub of excitement a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, thats all....far away from 4 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ohura
Reviews.Content: Good location, hotelstuff not helpfully and friendly. Better you need no help or informations about anything. Reception stuff fingered in turkish delices for guests, there stand 4 people bored behind the desk. Room was not clean, bathroom we found mold in the shower. Roem has TV, Safe,... Breakfast,waiter don't care when guest take a seat or need sth. Old fruits and vegetables. Not clean, waiter blow the table to clean it! We surely never come back!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: nouwwa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nippon Hotel and greatly enjoyed it. The we stayed in a Superior Corner room and got upgraded to a Suite (we stayed two times) both were great. The main difference is that the suite had a sitting area and a big bathroom with a Jacuzzi. The corner room was a good size minus was the very small bathroom. We had complimentary fruit baskets in both stays, and a call once we were in the room confirming that all was ok in the room. 2 bottles of water were provided daily and tea and coffee facility. Rooms were cleaned daily. During our stay the weather was around 9 degrees and the central heating was not working at the time, they provided us with extra blankets, that was the only thing i would complain about, but it seemed they didnt expect that cold weather in early october, i do not know, so maybe confirm if they have fixed the heating issue if planning to stay in colder months. the AC was working fine and we had no issues with cooling. Breakfast was OK. There was a variety of cheese, vegetables, fruits, breads, cereal and hot dishes such as sausages, pancakes, eggs however it does not change, so its nearly the same food every day, but thatâ€™s ok if you are staying for a couple of days you can make your own mix and match. We also ate in the coffeeshop on the ground floor, it was good (omlete and club sandwich). We took one tour, the Dolmabahce Palace, through the hotel and we had an issue as we thought we would be able to see the Harem however when we were on the way the guide mentions it is not included and there is no option but to miss our trip back if you do want to pay extra to see it. The guide book does not mention any extraâ€™s that we may chose. Anyways if anyone is planning to take this tour confirm that you will see the room if you are interested. Taking taxis from the hotel was easy and the tell you the approximate price that you will need to pay to make sure that the taxi driver does not rip you off. They also provide you with information for the metro if you want to use it. It location is great, it has a lot of souvenir shops around it, coffee shops and restaurants. It is also only exactly a 5 minute walk to the metro and Istiklal Street which is a great place to shop, eat and people watch. Overall, great service, location and rooms for our short touristy trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean hotel at strategic location”
Reviews.Author: Sy_Farhana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently for 6d5n with my husband for business+leisure trip. We booked online and they gave us a non-smoking room, located at upper floor & a double bed (as specifically requested). They managed to allow us to check-in early at 930am (due to room availability). We love our stay very much. Nippon Hotel is located a very strategic location in Taksim, where Taksim Square (transportation hub) is just 3-5 minutes walking distance. The famous shopping street, Istiklal Cadessi is also not far from Taksim Square. Among other things that made us choose this hotel is the nice, clean, minimalistic (japanese inspired) interior. We took the Superior Corner room. Has ample space with a double bed, a coffee table & seating arrangement & writing area. It suits business traveller. We are really satisfied with airport transfer service by the hotel. Very punctual. Overall, we don't mind staying at this hotel again. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, generic, clean and simple”
Reviews.Author: kansasforever
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Nippon for 2 nights in October 2011 and found it to be perfectly acceptable. Quiet and business like, but somehow lacks a personality. I was originally given a room facing construction works towards one side of the building, but when I asked to change, they were very accommodating, showing me a variety of rooms to choose from. The gym downstairs is very functional and was a nice touch. The location is perfect if you want to be located near Taksim Square and the shuttle bus to the airports is located 2 blocks away... very convenient for arrivals and departures. I guess I would stay here again, but it feels bland and lacks character... once inside the hotel, it could have been anywhere in the world. Nothing to complain about, but I think I would have preferred a more 'Turkish' type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Made me feel exceptionally welcome - but only while I was there.”
Reviews.Author: mkalfa
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Nippon Hotel for a single night, so I didn't get around to trying out the gym or room service. What I know is that the room was nice; I was greeted with a complimentary fruit basket. It was reasonably quite, albeit Taksim, a very busy area in the heart of Istanbul. The hotel is located in Taksim's "hotel street" - only taxis seem to get access. The taxis and shops here rely on their reputation, so they are a lot less likely to be tourist traps. Tourist half-day and day tours can be booked directly from the hotel, and I think I would recommend this; I decided to walk around the old town by myself on my day off and found it very difficult to ward off merchants and scammers. So much for my original review - I was really happy with the hotel when I left - now, sadly, the update: Back home, I noticed that my hotel receipt was incomplete (anyone who travels for business knows how much of a pain that can be) so I emailed the Nippon staff, asking for an updated receipt. It took several emails until someone replied - they asked me to post the original receipt back via regular mail, and I would get an updated version back. I did this - and waited, and waited, and emailed, and emailed... nearly two months later and after more than a handful emails which they ignored, I got an updated receipt - via email, to print myself. Now I really don't know why that required me to send the original back, as I had asked for something for myself to print in the first place. There was absolutely no reason this should have taken something like 8 emails and as many weeks to sort out - a big annoyance!

Reviews.Title: “Nippon-Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Worldwidediverjordan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nippon Hotel a few days ago......all in all a very good hotel. Service was good, the Japanese restaurant opposite the entrance was excellent (many Japanese go there it seems). The rooms are small but clean (we were in room 722) though i wouldn't recommend the breakfast. Also the robes we had in the room were taken away by housekeeping the second day of our stay and not renewed. The walls are thin and one tends to hear the neighbors (not talking levels but if they laugh you will hear them), also, you do hear the noise from the street (we were on the seventh floor). Location is excellent, but beware pimps in the area who try to get you to "clubs" were their girls are.

Reviews.Title: “Probably an okay business hotel..”
Reviews.Author: americanstreet
Reviews.Content: ...but not really that great for tourists. It's definitely a tourist hotel so I say that with some irony. What I did like: very large suite; convenient location right off Taksim Sq.; very comfortable bed. What I did not use but you might like: a very large flat screen tv; large jacuzzi tub What I did not like: so many tour buses lined up outside every morning that cabs couldn't even got to the door and the fumes made coffee on the outdoor patio impossible; obvious and unpleasant stains on carpets and furniture; thick dust on baseboards and some furniture; a terribly slow elevator; an ugly breakfast room that looks like a corporate cafeteria; a very mediocre breakfast buffet where everything that was supposed to be hot or cold was room temperature. This is a hotel that seems to have been designed by Japanese owners for single business men. There is literally only one chair in the room. All the lights in the two room suite are either on or off so that one person can not stay up and read or watch tv while the other sleeps. The enormous bathroom is lit like a dim bar rendering make up application a challenge. It's certainly far from a hardship to stay at this hotel but at 180 Euro I think there must be much better options.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the not so good”
Reviews.Author: Pasha55711
Reviews.Content: Good: Centralized Location, cleanliness, English speaking employees, prompt and kind service, decent breakfast buffet, quiet upper floors, nice bathrooms with a bide' [I just wonder how we do without in other countries] Not so Good: Balconies without chairs, low to the ground beds, desk size good only for a Geisha that is 5 ft tall, Lighting system that requires some getting used to and terrible reading lights and also not so good lighting in the batroom vanity mirror. Not a great value for what we are paying but the location made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “"Good Hotel for Business Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Ryan1017
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located very near a good variety of shops and restaurants. We stayed there for a total of 3 nights, the service provided by the hotel staff for business is very professional and of high quality. The staff in the restaurant, lobby, and reception are very professional and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a meeting at the nearby conference center (10 min walk). Well situated both for the conference center and transport from the airport (e.g., the Havas buses), and many restaurants both in the immediate hotel vicinity and a short walk away (Taksim square). Straightforward public transport to the famous tourist sites. The room was fine but did not have enough clothing storage space for two people. All hotel services were overly expensive for the class of the hotel (e.g., airport transfers, breakfasts (which were not included for me)). On the other hand the basic rate was very fine. I would stay here again for a business trip, but look elsewhere for vacation. (Which is exactly what I did).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for value”
Reviews.Author: Pris11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is your average 4 stara hotel, European standard. The location was great, near the metro station that was good to visit the sites. A little bit of a language barrier,but overall the staff was really nice. Good breakfast, full buffet and excellent coffee. The beds were good, the pillows not so great, and some of the beading was torn,in need of replacement. One detail with the authorization lon the credit card, you get charge up front and it is confusing when no prepayment is shown on the bill. We had a very late check in, and were given the penthouse suit for the first night. The staff was really nice helping us locatelost luggage at the airport

Reviews.Title: “A good business place to hole up in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Coastersretreat
Reviews.Content: It's neither a top notch business hotel or a tourist place but it offers clean functional rooms and pretty good service. It is also close to the Istiklal Mall. Importantly for Istanbul, the air condition works. Goof value.

Reviews.Title: “second stay at nippon but this time wasn't great”
Reviews.Author: hiba26
Reviews.Content: i stayed at Nippon hotel for second time because my first stay at this hotel was great but this time it wasn't, we arrived at the hotel around 10 am in the morning, i called the hotel 1 day before our arrival asking them for an early check in because i have 2 children with me & they gave me the room when i arrived which is a good thing, but the problem was they gave me a very small room for a family with kids & the window in the room was very small with a view of a wall in front of it, i can say that this room is more suitable to be a storage room! i called the front desk 3 times asking for a baby crib & then they bring me a mattress to put on the floor!! how am i supposed to let my 1 year old baby sleep on the floor!! later i found some flying bugs in the room & the bathroom & felt very uncomfortable & asked them to change my room & they did that very quickly. the other room was more specious with large window & finally we had sun light in the room, but the problem with the new room was the noise even if the window is closed we still hear all the noise on the street, the second problem was that the duvet covers was ripped from more than one place, i was very disappointed because l didn't expect to see all this problems in the hotel because i stayed at this hotel last year & our stay was great & the hotel was more clean & the service was better.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Andrejosephine
Reviews.Content: Mix up with booking gave us twin beds instead of a double thus dampened an Anniversary stay. Water and tea not replenished and tea cups left dirty each day. Air conditioner not efficient and tv with many channels with no sound. Wifi worked near bathroom but not in main section of room. Room small and noisy. Lots of street noise. No tissues supplied. Staff pleasant and attentive. We tried this 4 star but will now continue to book 5. Yes, we could have complained but feel you should not have to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and well located”
Reviews.Author: karr147
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very professional and willing to assist with bookings and advice. Hotel 5 minutes walk from Taksim shops and metro station. Very clean rooms which were well maintained (ours had no view but was otherwise fine). Nice bathrooms. Breakfast was good and overall service was 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthonynassar96
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Nippon hotel 4 nights. the hotel is at 3-4 minutes walk from Taksim square. The triple room was large and clean. the staff was very helpful when we wanted to take a tour to the DolmabaÃ§e palace. Breafast very consistant and a very big variety of food. I recommend that hotel to everyone who want to go to Turkey but it's a little bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: AshyAsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week (first week of August) 2011, my family and my in laws, we had 2 rooms: suite and superior corner room, both were spacious with very good furniture. Staff were very kind and helpful always attentive and assisting our every need. breakfast was included in our booking and it was served between 7 to 10:30 , it had a very good variety such as fresh bakery and fruits. Hotel location is only 3-5 min walk from Taksim Square which is a main attraction of the city, close to the isteklal shopping street. The hotel area is a pedestrian zone, no cars allowed except taxi and tour buses, Nippon Hotel offers valet service as we had our rental car they allow us to enter the pedestrian zone anytime and we will park next to our hotel and the hotel staff will pick up the car and park it in the parking all this free of charge! we loved our suite which had good space and had a nice spacious bathroom with jacuzzi and shower facilities , also it had a large terrace we can sit there in the evening. the other room (superior corner room) was also good space (double bed + small sitting area) with a normal size bathroom. Since the Hotel is Japanese style, the beds were a bit lower height than normal beds we did not find a problem also my in laws (late 70s) did not have any discomfort for that. the mattress was very comfortable! By the way, the hotel has wireless internet free for all guests, and there is a business center to use the computer and printer there, we didnt use it. we recommend this hotel for the great service and good staff, and for the nice clean rooms with nice neat furniture and comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Locations”
Reviews.Author: fayrouz
Reviews.Content: in Taksim area you can find lots of hotels holding 4 stars, i stayed in many of them, but Nippon is one of the few REAL 4 stars hotels. a real nice hotel with identity. Good value and location, good service, friendly staff and clean rooms. Nothing to complain about if you are family, or business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location, Service”
Reviews.Author: NMS23
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, stayed here on two different occasions and was given 5-Star treatment for the price of 3.5. Something about fruit baskets, fresh robes, and free newspapers make my jet lag go away . Everyone there is friendly and helpful and the rooms are very high quality. Upgrade to the suite if it fits your budget, you won't be disappointed. Possibly my favorite hotel in the world for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Canthinkofaname
Reviews.Content: Good location for shopping (although the Blue Mosque and Ortakoy (sp?) aren't within walking distance), friendly efficient check-in, clean and comfortable room, a gym, a great breakfast buffet (lthough not included and not cheap), free wifi in rooms. One rather alarming feature - room service staff knock once and burst in without giving you a chance to answer or make yourself decent! Thank goodness I managed to grab a duvet. It happened more than once although I'm not sure if it was the same member of staff. I didn't use the business centre but I did ask whether they had a meeting room with computers for training/assessment. That seemed to throw them - I think they've just got a couple of PCs in a small room. Apart from that, it was a good hotel and I'd certainly stay there again on business or holiday and I'd certainly recommend Istanbul as a city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and worth what you paid”
Reviews.Author: MrTripsEver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, comfortable, organised with good location in Taksim quarter area where only pedestrians allowed and very near to Istiklal street, metro, and Harbiya area. Though the rooms were small with no view, but very clean, the room facilities are stylish with free Internet and 2 small bottles of water every day. The breakfast is buffet with delicious but not wide variety of food. You can say that you get what you paid for and it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DeeAnn18
Reviews.Content: All of your staff including the doormen, bellboys, waiters and waitresses and front desk clerks were friendly. I was impressed that the bottles of water were free and a fresh fruit plate was delivered to my room complimentary of Nippon Hotel. Also, upon checking in my hotel room, someone called me from guest services to see if I needed anything for my room. The internet was free and I had access to the business center where I could use the internet and also print copies free of charge. The breakfast buffet was excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a clean, and central location right in Taksim and close to Istikal Street.

Reviews.Title: “everything I could ask for”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nippon Hotel for 8 nights in May. The location was perfect, 10 min away from Istiklal but still in a quiet street. My room was very nicely decorated, very clean. The mattress was a bit hard but I slept well anyway. Choice of pillows, fruit basket, complimentary bottles of water. I had minor issues with the remote control but they fixed it very quickly. Actually, the staff was very efficient and pleasant. Every little thing that I asked was dealt with right away. Room service was quick. One good meal, one not so good meal. Didn't try breakfast. There are two computers you can use, free of charge. Speed was fine and almost nobody was using them. This hotel being more of a business hotel, I suppose everybody had their own laptop to use. The Havas bus from the airport drops you 2 blocks away, it's very simple. Also it's very simple to get to the old city by public transport. Just take the funicular to Kabatas and then the tram to Sultanahmet and you're there in 20 min. I really enjoyed my stay. Travelling by myself, I wanted to feel safe and I did. Other than that, absolutely perfect place for me. There are plenty of restaurants just around the corner if you don't feel like going all the way to Istiklal. And there are also a few corner stores where you can get anything you want. Much much cheaper than the mini-bar in your room. I would definitely go back there if I returned to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “decent value but not the best”
Reviews.Author: bblumberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my wife and teenage daughter while attending a meeting in Istanbul in May 2011. The hotel staff was extraordinarily helpful and attentive to our needs, even noticing that one day was my wife's birthday and surprising her with a small cake. The property is newly renovated and relatively comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious but rather overpriced. Rooms were small and beds not particularly comfortable, not unlike those in small Japanese hotels. Whenever we asked the concierge for a tour or restaurant recommendation, he whipped out a preprinted brochure for some nearby place, likely one that they had business dealings with. The doormen were a much better source of local information. All in all, a reasonable hotel but not a particularly good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ecossenprovence
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and the Nippon hotel made an excellent base from which to explore this wonderful city. The hotel was quiet and had all the amenities to make for a comfortable stay. The gym was particularly welcomed by my wife. The restaurant manager,Tayfun was a pleasure to meet, and very informative when talking about the city and how to get around. Thanks to all the staff for their efficient and friendly service. Especially welcomed when we arrived early in the morning in the rain and the receptionist immediately found as a free room, a treat after traveling all night and yearning for a place to lay a weary head. Also the hotel is located very close to the airport bus stop, about 250 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: isti83
Reviews.Content: Super Service. They fullfilled every wish. Great breakfast buffet. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms and decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: donalmca
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and staff were efficient. Minor gripes with the noise in the rooms from outside, problems with my tv remote and some of the channels not working but overall would be happy to stay there again. Note that they do not do laundry on Sundays which caught me out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Duysal
Reviews.Content: First time visit to Istanbul and first time stay at Nippon Hotel. Location is very close to Taksim Square which is excellent. The hotel was very clean. The staff at rececption was very helpful and alway on hand to help. Once checked-in i was shown to my room and shown around and told where everything is etc. Within half an hour of settling in i got a call from reception to ask if i was happy with my room and if i needed anything. Which i thought was very nice. Overall a very lovely hotel and would definately stay there again. I would very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: docbaz
Reviews.Content: this hotel was excellent in all respects. much more than i anticipated prior to the trip. yes, its in a busy central area which is easily the best location to access most areas. it can be noisy but i wasnt too bothered. the hotel is clean. compared to business colleagues who stayed in far more expensive hotels in the city, this hotel was excellent value and pretty much 5 star for service and cleanliness. the staff were extremely helpful, especially Alihan who advised and helped a lot. i found the hilton staff where my conference was held extremely rude, arrogant and unhelpful - i am glad i didnt stay there. more expensive does not always mean better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service but noisy and not great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Victor1234
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel go out of their way to give you and excellent service and I have to congratulate them for that. The hotel provides lots of great extras like free WIFI, a free business centre and you even get a free daily ironing service. The negative side is that the rooms are terribly noisy and it's hard to sleep. I was on a 9th floor but could perfectly hear the music from a nearby establishment till after 1am which forced me to use ear plugs. There was also a draft from the window so very poor isolation. The hotel wasn't cheap so I would expect a lot more from the quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep for a week.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny077
Reviews.Content: This was one of my most miserable stays in a hotel. I was travelling on business and chose this hotel because of the location and the reviews on this website. The hotel is very modern in design and I received a warm welcome on arrival. However I was given a 'non-smoking' room that stank of smoke - it was possibly coming in through the air conditioning. The room was also at the back of the hotel and I only found out late at night when all the air conditioning units hummed into life, just how thin the windows were! I also had a large group of men in a room to one side and the walls were so thin you could hear every word. I asked to switch rooms because of the smell and the noise but was told they were fully booked and could not move me. I left my window open all day when out to try and get rid of the smell but nothing worked and the hotel offered no assistance. I stayed there for 5 nights and had such poor sleep because of the noise I would never stay there again if I need a restful stay! Might be better for people on holiday in Istanbul who don't have to get up early.

Reviews.Title: “dream days at Nippon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nad_2011
Reviews.Content: i asked a turkish/Syrian friend about a very nice place to spend my new year's vacation in Istanbul he said Nippon hotel and although i am used to Hilton and intercont group but i said let's try this one since my friend recommended it and from the moment i steped in the hotel and say all the staff with thier close to heart smile i said yes.. i want to be here nothing i can say to tell you how sweet and nice welcome smile you get from Gizem the young pretty lady at the reception a smile let you feel that you will have very nice stay all the staff are friendly and greet you like a real friend not a stranger rooms are nice calm and clean i got the best suite they have and it was value of money relaxing and comfortable i really recommend this hotel it is a complete package of fun and relaxation and it is in very nice area of Istanbul Taksim if there is a rating more than 5 i would really go for it thanks Nippon and special thanks to Gizem and to the doorman (who is a very friendly person also) see you soon ;)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sameer69
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences I ever had in this Hotel. The hospitality and service is outstanding. The staff was very helpful and very attentive. I must say, the service is one among the best I have ever been to and they take care of individual need with great interest. The location is quite close to the shopping areas, nightlife and easily accessible to public transport. The room is a little small, but comfortable for 2 people. The additional services ( free laundry, free water bottles etc) was great. The staffs make sure that they give priority to the guests and deliver maximum assistance in all your needs, and more over they serve you with a smile. I have already recommended this Hotel to my friends who will be visiting Istanbul next month. I would also like to thank the Guest Relationship Manager (Mr. Alehandro) for his assistance to guide us to various locations in Istanbul. OVERALL - ABSOLUTELY SUPERB!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Palmfreak
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Nippon hotel for two nights on a business trip. Nippon hotel is very close to the main shopping area (Taksim) They gave me a free upgrade to a superioir suite with a balcony (corner room). My stay was extremely pleasant. Absolutely nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Big S!”
Reviews.Author: TA4tobias
Reviews.Content: I am writting this review after staying at the Nippon Hotel in Istanbul twice. The first time in September 2010 and now the second time in November 2010. On both occassions the hospitality and service are really great. People are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are very good, equiped with everything you need, or what you can otherwise ask for at the reception. It is in walking distance of Taksim Square and shopping streets and many many restaurants - very conveniently located! I recommend anybody this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel with a great service”
Reviews.Author: LauraPortugal
Reviews.Content: I liked very much to stay at this hotel. The staff is very kindness and the rooms are great. It has a good fitness center and a 24 hours avaiable business center. If I return to Istanbul it will be certainly my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: grapegirl26
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't glamorous but it is in a great location, close to Taksim Square which means walking distance to lots of restaurants, cafes and sites. Many convenience stores nearby for miscellaneous items (and inexpensive, too). Good choices for breakfast buffet, and free Internet use - two computers upstairs near the restaurant. Many rooms, like ours, don't have a view - instead, they face walls and/or the garbage. But the rooms are comfy and mostly clean. The beds are a little too low to the floor and the linens are average. Staff were friendly. Lots of traffic in Istanbul! But the city is beautiful, awesome sites and so much culture to soak in.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent service it's a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hiba26
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Nippon hotel for 5 days & it was a great experience, the rooms was so clean but a little bit small, about the location it's perfect it's in walking distance to taksim square & there is a taxi station in the same street of the hotel & a lot of small super markets if you need to buy water or some food. the service was more than great one day we went down for break fast & the buffet was closed & we called the reception & it seemed that there was a misunderstanding about the times they called us back & said go down to the buffet we found that they prepared a table for us with a full breakfast items, that was super for me this is a 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Efficient hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: missfickle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on short business trip. Istanbul wonderful city, unfortunately not enough time to expolore however the Nippon Hotel was in a good location, very clean and comfortable and would be happy to stay again. Public areas nicely decorated, reasonable meeting facilitities and food fresh, very good. The bedroom I was allocated was the smallest I have ever stayed in, just enough room to house a bed and desk, fitted wardrobe. En suite no bath. The single bed didn't look comfortable but surprisingly very comfortable! The staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Taksim, close to everything! Lots to do in area.”
Reviews.Author: Rockhopper2413
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our culinary tour. The rooms are very nice, the staff very helpful. It's a great location, with lots of restaurants and shops near by. Very easy to get to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelbirds0809
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, great service, great location and great value. Although we had booked a standard room, we were upgraded to a suite at no charge. The breakfast was great and all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location was very close to all the action of Taksim, but away enough to be in a quiet location. We would definitely stay there if we were to return to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelerr07
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other 5 star hotel in Istanbul, however I have to admit that this hotel is much better and far way better service than the other 5 star hotel i went to in Istanbul. I have stayed at other hotels in Turkey, the staff were kind of unfriendly and never smile. However in this hotel, almost every staff smiles with you and were very friendly. This gave a spirit to this hotel. I felt comfortable with them. We stayed in a suite room, room was amazing with excellent room amenities, the room had a modern Japanese style. We loved our room. When we had a complaint they would immediately send someone to attend to our complaint. there was no noise at all during our sleep, the hotel is in a quite neighborhood, and just walking distance to Taksim square. The breakfast buffet was also amazing, had a lot of selections. It was very close to the Havas Bus station, so you could easily take the bus to the airport. Overall, excellent hotel, and I would strongly recommend it for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Too loud!”
Reviews.Author: Anon1997
Reviews.Content: The only positive aspect of this hotel was the location. Everything else was very poor. I chose this hotel because it was approximately 20 euros cheaper than the adjacent hotels. I stayed five nights. After the first night, I requested a room change because our neighbors were a bit loud and the Internet connection was poor. On our fourth night, our new neighbors were loud again. This time at 4 in the morning! Since I was here on business, I needed to get some sleep to function during the day. I finally resorted to calling the front desk. This helped a little bit as the neighbors turned down their tv but they were still too loud for me to sleep. I called the front desk again and seemed some peace without avail. I don't mind people having fun and enjoying themelves but being woken up in the middle of the night 2 out of the 5 nights with very little intervention from the hotel staff to mitigate this problem was not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hexmax
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The location is excellent since there are many restaurants, bars, and shops around. Due to the location it may be a littble bit too noisy for some people. However, we didn't have a problem with this. Besides that, this hotel offers free transer from the airport and free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience in ist.”
Reviews.Author: victoriapablo
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 5 nights. the best location: close to everything (one block from Havas airport bus and 3 to istiklal caddessi) and VERY QUIET. personnel was very very friendly. the concierge is the most friendly one i have ever met. would love to return, good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, ideally situated good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: jamestoo
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, clean, and comfortable with helpful and obliging staff. Room was modern and a little small but comfortable non the less. Buffet breakfast was good with quite a diverse selection. The hotel is centrally situated for sightseeing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice european hotel in a good location to explore istanbul”
Reviews.Author: robthewasp
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights in mid may and used it as a base to explore istanbul. Great location being just off the main centre street of taksim square. It is very safe and quiet at night being located in an area that has other european hotels around it (not that i found anywhere in turkey unsafe but when you first arrive in a country you are a bit unsure about where is safe and where isn't). The staff are friendly and hel;pful and although they don't all speak great english there is always soemone around for those of us ignotant enough to to be able to speak their native language. The hotel is clean and quiet, has a good business centre that is open late and a great little gym that is staffed and open late also. The front of the hotel is not open to cars so is very quiet at night (remember you are in a city that has a population of 16 million people). Modern bathroom, air conditioning, safe, satelite tv with english channels, room service, good restaurant....he pretty much had everything you would want and only Â£90 a night for 2 people. Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mazd31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in June 2010. Istanbul was the last stop on our vacation to Italy, Greece and Turkey. Although we stayed at some amazing hotels, Nippon was the best value for money hotel we stayed at during our trip. Staff were friendly and professional. Rooms were spacious and very clean. We were welcomed with a fruit platter and also a list of complimentary services, which included 2 free bottles of water, pillow menu, ironing service, and daily newspaper. We literally handed a gentleman a pair of my husbands jeans and wrinkled shirt and he ironed them for us perfectly at no charge! Its the small things a hotel does to make your stay special, and Nippon knows how to do this well! Breakfast was amazing. Fresh and great variety. Tyfoon the breakfast manager was very friendly and helpful explaining to us where to go in Istanbul. Location was very good. Although close to the hustle and bustle of Taksim square, it was in a quiet street surrounded by other hotels and restaurants. Taksim was lively at any time of the night and metro was also nearby to see the sights. Highly recommend staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: fidesvisanimus
Reviews.Content: Me and by boyfriend arrived in Istanbul on a Friday evening and the hotel we had booked was just horrible so we decided we would change hotel the next early morning. I saw Nippon Hotel on internet and we decided to go see it. Besides the great location just a few steps from Taksim Square, we were very well impressed by this beautiful 4 star hotel and its staff. The guy at the reception, Emrah, was extremely nice showing us some different categories of rooms and taking care of our check-in. Gizem, the concierge, was as well very efficient in explaining us how to move in the city and booking us some restaurants. All the doormen were kind and helpfull. Great breakfast, nice environment, definitely a great place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Very good service hotel, but not very soundproof”
Reviews.Author: Guest087
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the location were good. It's in Taksim, on the European side, close to Taksim square and many restaurants. There are many other hotels in the area as well. The room was clean and the service was excellent. There was a fruit bowl in the room when you arrive. However, I had some noisy neighbours and as the walls are very thin, I could not catch sleep. Also the windows are not soundproof as you can here the noise from outside. Overall a good hotel, but if I would visit Istanbul again, I would probably decide to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: c_aydin
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the kindness of the employees, the breakfast was amazing and also the size of my room ( I have had a corner room ) was great. I will book again, thanks to everyone at Nippon hotel. there is nothing to complain. *****

Reviews.Title: “MS PROJECT TRAINING”
Reviews.Author: AKINKILINC
Reviews.Content: Everything is very nice, I was pleasure during I was staying. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Sojourn3
Reviews.Content: Room clean, staff attentive, lunch-good food, breakfast OK. Wireless service not great; kept disconnecting in room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nyousef
Reviews.Content: i've stayed there with my husband and friends for 5 days, it was very comfortable, close to Taksim square, the main point i care about is cleanliness and this hotel was extremely clean and organized. the staff were very helpful and helped us calling our trip guide whenever he was late for no charge and they do speak good english we were able to communicate with them easily. the bufet breakfast was average with not many choices but it was ok all in all. if i go back to Istanbul i dont mind staying at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely choice”
Reviews.Author: Maxone80
Reviews.Content: I was with my wife from 1st to 5th of august 2009. The location is great (Taxim Area) and the room too. The bathroom is very nice and clean. It's a really 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for congress visit and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Girl67
Reviews.Content: Been in the hotel for 3 nights during a congress in Istanbul. Very nice hotel in great location. Area is being kept car free due to special access entrance in the area. Quiet place but within a few minutes walk you are in the middle of hectic Istanbul (Taksim square)

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ooncindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Nippon Hotel in early June 09. Our flight arrived at 7:30am and were given early check-in. The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful. They even wrote the destinations we were going to visit in Turkish so that the taxi drivers and bus drivers can alert us where to alight. The rooms are clean and we were given a selection of pillows to choose from. Breakfast selection is good with many items to choose from. The only thing I did not like about the hotel is the very dim lighting along the corridor leading to the rooms. The room itself was brightly lit though so no complains there. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel as a good stay to explore the fascinating city of Istanbul. I would definitely return to this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, clean, great location place from which to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: holidayjunkieBejing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nippon hotel for 6 nights. We were a school group of 17 and the Nippon staff provided excellent service for what we felt was good value for money. The location in Taksim was very convenient for visiting all the tourist sites. There are many small restaurants near the hotel and in the main shopping street in Taksim Square. Sultanahmet was easy to get to via the subway and tram system. Breakfast was excellent and my students found plenty to satisfy their very fussy tastes. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtex
Reviews.Content: We were at Nippon Hotel for a weekend, it's a very good hotel, the location is perfect, near the the Etstaclal street, the room was big and very clean the breakfast was rich and the hotel service was excellence. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! We LOOOVVVED the Nippon!!”
Reviews.Author: lblahnik
Reviews.Content: We randomly walked into the Nippon and booked a room. We loved everything about this hotel and ended up staying here for the remainder of our trip to Turkey. The front desk was pleasant and efficient. The room was modern, minimalist style and was extremely clean. Gorgeous bathroom! They provided us with free electricity converters! There is free internet in the business area. The breakfast was consistently good-a Turkish style breakfast. Finally, I cannot say enough good things about the concierge!! She was amazingly helpful with everything from giving us instructions on how to ride the metro to get to other parts of the city to helping us book (what ended up being an amazing trip to Capadoccia). She was very knowledgeable and sweet. We were very comfortable here and didnt want to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Minoue-Sisteron
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in June08 for business purpose. Situated in Taksim area, which, I think, safe and clean area, and there are many luxury hotels around. Many restaurants around and 5 min to Metro, which was complicate to use at first. Walking distance to one of main street of the city. About 15â‚¬ or 10Â£ to old city by taxi or if you like nice half-an-hour to one-hour walk to cross golden horn bridge. Definitely recommended for business travellers, but if you want to visit old sites, probably stay around old city would be convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, neat and tidy”
Reviews.Author: DesignLoverLondon
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right off Taksim Square. The price wasn't cheap, but it was the Grand Prix weekend and therefore rates were high. The hotel is very noisy and has very strange shaped rooms. I stayed there for a conference and spoke to many attendees who weren't happy with their rooms. The street noise is very apparent and the room doors are very close so the noise does carry. However, the hotel is clean but small. Everything that you will need, but rooms are not particularly cosy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: avihu420
Reviews.Content: well, we enjoy our stay very much. it looks exactly like at nippon homepage, modern jappanies decoration. the best breakfast i could dream of. 100m from taxim sq. and close to coffeshops, resturants and modern shops. we will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Nippon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: francoisel
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for business last week and I want to recomend Nippon Hotel in Taksim area. It's a good, not pricy four stars. The rooms are very clean,trendy and there is a nice place to work if you need. The hotel is in a quiet street and in Istanbul, it's very important because it's a very big city, very noisy. The metro and all the busses are very close and also a lot of nice cafes,shops and small places to eat.

HotelInfo.Name: Nippon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Topcu Cd. No 6 | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
